Goals:
A project's goals are specific targets and outcomes the team seeks so it can achieve its mission. The most useful and achievable goals are those that are SMART:

- Specific
- Measurable
- Achievable
- Relevant
- Timely

Values:
Values are guiding principles that direct and prioritise goals. They should support the project's mission by setting guidelines for the team's conduct and the founder's management and leadership philosophy.

Mission:
The mission should capture the fundamental purpose of the project and explains how the project will achieve its vision. A project's mission and vision should complement each other.

Vision:
A project's vision is a guiding concept that contains aspirations. It describes where the project wants to be in the future and offers a set of priorities and ideals.

Here are something that I have learned when I was studying for my CPA and have been applying into the NFTs space besides Tax:

There are four things that I look for in a project's Roadmap/ Whitepaper:

Vision, Mission, Values and Goals ğŸ‘‡

The argument is that staking rewards are taxpayer-created property and should not be taxed until sold or exchanged. However, a settlement offer from the IRS is not the same as a binding precedent, itâ€™d be interesting to see how it will unfold. https://t.co/21US6DXEF1

Finally, super fund can be a powerful tool for your wealth generation strategy. If you are considering investing in crypto using your super fund, it is best for you to consult with a qualified professional.

5/5 Costs 
The cost of running an SMSF can be disadvantageous when the assets held within the SMSF are relatively low in value.
But it can be cost-competitive with public offer funds when the asset balance is around $200k; and become cost-effective as the asset balance grows.

4/5 The Fund also needs to prepare and lodge financial statements and tax return each year, and have these audited.  A qualified tax professional can assist you with these compliance and administration requirements.

3/5 This means you need to:
- understand how investment markets work, including both share and crypto markets
- keep record of your investments and transactions
- ensure your fund is adequately diversified to help manage risk.
2/5 The Fundsâ€™ investments must also pass the Sole Purpose Test, which ensures that all investments choices are made for the sole purpose of providing retirement benefits to their members.

1/5 Cons - Duties & Responsibilities
As a trustee, youâ€™re responsible for the compliance of your SMSF, including creating and implementing the Fundâ€™s investment strategy â€” one that will need to deliver enough returns to adequately fund your retirement.
4/4 Having control means trustees can quickly adjust the Fundâ€™s portfolio following market changes, taking advantage of investment opportunities.

3/4 Pros - Flexibility and control compared to normal Super fund

Trustees have ability to invest directly in a wider range of assets classes, and the flexibility to tailor the rules of the SMSF to suit the members specific needs and circumstances.
2/4 And if you are in retirement phase when you sell, all income maybe tax exempt â€“ meaning you will 0% tax on any capital gains (assuming your fund is 100% in retirement phase).

Pros and Cons 

1/4 Pros - Tax benefits
Income in your SMSF is generally taxed at the concessional rate of 15%, and capital assets held for longer than 12 months at only 10% (after the 1/3 discount) rather than 50% of your marginal tax rate (which could be as high as 47%)

7/7 and to articulate how investing in crypto assets meets the goals of the members, and that consideration is given to diversification, risk, returns and liquidity â€“ and that these considerations are well documented in the Fundâ€™s investment strategy.

6/7 If SMSF trustees do wish to invest in crypto in their SMSF, there are some important factors that need to be considered in order to meet the ATOâ€™s requirements. It is important to ensure the trust deed allows for investment in cryptocurrency;

5/7 One of the big advantages of SMSFs is the ability for trustees to invest directly in a wider range of asset classes â€“ such as crypto.  They have the flexibility and control to tailor their investment portfolio based on the specific needs and circumstances of the members

4/7 For some, the investment decision making process is made with the help of a financial advisor, however with crypto assets SMSF trustees are on their own - with advisors in Australia typically unable to offer advice on digital assets (at least to retail clients).

3/7 With #BTC as low as $14k on 13 Sep 20, and $61k on 12 Sep 21 (335% return across 12 months), in this same period, #Eth grew 767%. Itâ€™s easy to see the appeal for investors with the appetite for risk. Given the recent dip, investors might find this could be a good entry point
2/7 The distribution of cryptocurrency assets in SMSF is also biased towards smaller, and one could assume, funds with younger members in accumulation phase: https://t.co/IuyLiDPEHe

1/7 - Background 
According to the latest ATO statistics report, Australians held approximately $228M in crypto assets as at 30 Sep 2021 in their super fund - only 0.028% of total assets (less than a statistical anomaly).
